setting.name: Association Indication
setting.description: The association status code. This is used to monitor association progress. 0=success, 1=Transceiver Initialization time, 2=Stage 2 of initialization, 13=Disconnecting from AP, 23=SSID not configured, 24=Invalid encryption key, 27=Authentication failure, 40=Waiting for Authentication, 41=Waiting for DHCP, 42=Setting up listening sockets, ff=scanning for AP

setting.name: Device Cloud Indicator
setting.description: Monitor Device Cloud connectivity. 0=Connected, 1=Before association to AP, 2=Device Cloud connection in progress, 3=Disconnecting from Device Cloud, 4=Not configured for Device Cloud

setting.name: Channel
setting.description: The channel of the connected access point (FF if not joined). When this module is the ADHOC creator (AH1) this channel is settable.

setting.name: Link Margin
setting.description: The average link margin (signal strength above sensitivity in dB) of the most recent packets received since association to AP (or FF if not associated).

setting.name: Power Level
setting.description: The transmitter output power.

setting.name: Network type
setting.description: The network type. (IBSS means AdHoc)

setting.name: Infrastructure Mode
setting.description: Selects AP mode (1) or STA mode (2)

setting.name: SSID
setting.description: The SSID of the desired access point

setting.name: Encryption Enable
setting.description: The security mode. Needs to match the security mode of the access point.

setting.name: Passphrase
setting.description: The passphrase used for WEP, WPA and WPA2 security. This parameter cannot be read.

setting.name: IP Protocol
setting.description: The protocol used for the listening port (ATC0).

setting.name: IP Addressing Mode
setting.description: The IP addressing mode.

setting.name: TCP Client Connection Timeout
setting.description: The TCP client connection timeout. If no activity for this timeout then the connection is closed. When set to 0 the connection is closed immediately after data is sent.

setting.name: TCP Server Connection Timeout
setting.description: The TCP server connection timeout. If no activity for this timeout then the connection is closed. When set to 0 the connection is closed immediately after data is sent.

setting.name: Device Options
setting.description: Device Options Bit field. Bit 0 - Enable Device Cloud, Bit 1 - Enable SoftAP when ID is NULL, Bit 2 - Send transparent data to Device Cloud, Bit 3 - Send I/O samples to both Device Cloud and DL if Device Cloud is enabled, Bit 4 - Send transparent data as a data stream (1) or a file (0), Bit 5 - Replace a file (1) or append to a file (0). Bits 6,7 - ignored.

setting.name: Device Cloud FQDN
setting.description: Fully Qualified Domain name of Device Cloud Server.

setting.name: Serial Number High
setting.description: The upper 16 bits of the unique IEEE 48-bit MAC Address assigned to this module.

setting.name: Serial Number Low
setting.description: The lower 32 bits of the unique IEEE 48-bit MAC Address assigned to this module.

setting.name: DNS Address
setting.description: IPv4 address of domain name server.

setting.name: Destination IP Address
setting.description: The destination IPv4 address. 255.255.255.255 is the broadcast address.

setting.name: Node Identifier
setting.description: The node identifier string for this module. This can be up to 20 ASCII characters. This value can be used to easily identify modules.

setting.name: Device Cloud Description
setting.description: Description of the module that is displayed on Device Cloud.

setting.name: Device Cloud Contact
setting.description: Contact information for the module that is displayed on Device Cloud.

setting.name: Device Cloud Location
setting.description: Location of the module that is displayed on Device Cloud.

setting.name: Source Port
setting.description: The listening IP port number for UDP and TCP operations

setting.name: Destination Port
setting.description: The destination IP port number.

setting.name: IP Address of gateway
setting.description: The IP address of the gateway. This command will be read only if module is setup for DHCP

setting.name: IP Address Mask
setting.description: The IP address subnet mask. This command will be read only if module is setup for DHCP

setting.name: Module IP Address
setting.description: The IP address of the module. This command will be read only if module is setup for DHCP

setting.name: Baud Rate
setting.description: The serial interface baud rate for communication between the serial port of the module and the host. Request non-standard baud rates with values above 0x80 using a terminal window and then read the BD parameter to find actual baud rate achieved.

setting.name: Parity
setting.description: The parity for the UART.

setting.name: Stop Bits
setting.description: The number of stop bits for the UART.

setting.name: Packetization Timeout
setting.description: The number of character times of inter-character delay required before transmission begins. Set to zero to transmit characters as they arrive instead of buffering them into one RF packet.

setting.name: Flow Control Threshold
setting.description: The flow control threshold. De-assert CTS when FT bytes are in the UART receive buffer.

setting.name: API Enable
setting.description: The API mode setting. RF Packets received can be formatted into API frames to be sent out the UART. When API is enabled the UART data must be formatted as API frames as transparent mode is disabled.

setting.name: API Options
setting.description: The API data frame type output format for received frames. This parameter applies to both the UART and SPI interfaces.

setting.name: DIO0/AD0
setting.description: The DIO0/AD0 pin configuration. Options include: Commissioning button, Analog to Digital converter, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO1/AD1/SPI_ATTN
setting.description: The DIO1/AD1/SPI_ATTN pin configuration. Options include: SPI_ATTN, Analog to Digital converter, Digital Input and Output, and UART data present indicator.

setting.name: DIO2/AD2/SPI_SCLK
setting.description: The DIO2/AD2/SPI_SCLK pin configuration. Options include: SPI slave clock input, Analog to Digital converter, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO3/AD3/SPI_SSEL
setting.description: The DIO3/AD3/SPI_SSEL pin configuration. Options include: SPI Slave select, Analog to Digital converter, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO4/SPI_MOSI
setting.description: The DIO4/SPI_MOSI pin configuration. Options include: SPI Slave MOSI, Analog to Digital converter, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO5/ASSOCIATED_INDICATOR
setting.description: The DIO5/ASSOCIATED_INDICATOR pin configuration. Options include: Associated LED indicator (blinks when associated), Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO6/RTS
setting.description: The DIO6/RTS pin configuration. Options include: RTS flow control input, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO7/CTS
setting.description: The DIO7/CTS pin configuration. Options include: CTS flow control output, Digital Input and Output, or RS-485 enable control.

setting.name: DIO8/SLEEP_REQUEST
setting.description: The DIO8/SLEEP_REQUEST pin configuration. Options include: Sleep Request input, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO9/ON_SLEEP
setting.description: The DIO9/ON_SLEEP pin configuration. Options include: ON/SLEEP Output, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO10/RSSI/PWM0
setting.description: The DIO10/RSSI/PWM0 pin configuration. Options include: RSSI PWM Output, PWM0 Output, Digital Input, and Output.

setting.name: DIO11/PWM1
setting.description: The DIO11/PWM1 pin configuration. Options include: PWM1 Output, Digital Input, and Output.

setting.name: DIO12/SPI_MISO
setting.description: The DIO12 pin configuration. Options include: SPI Slave MISO, TCP connection indicator, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO13/DOUT
setting.description: The DIO13/DOUT pin configuration. Options include: Disabled, UART DOUT enabled.

setting.name: DIO14/DIN
setting.description: The DIO14/DIN pin configuration. Options include: Disabled, UART DIN enabled.

setting.name: Pull Direction
setting.description: The resistor pull direction bit field (1=pullup, 0=pull-down) for corresponding I/O lines that are set in PR command.

setting.name: Pull-up/down Resistor Enable
setting.description: The bit field used to configure internal pull-up/down resistors status for I/O lines. 1=internal pull-up/down enabled, 0=no internal pull-up/down. Bit field map: (14)-DIO13/DOUT, (13)-DIO7/CTS, (12)-DIO11/PWM1, (11)-DIO10/PWM0, (10)-DIO12, (9)-DIO9/On/nSleep, (8)-DIO5/Assoc., (7)-DIO14/DIN/Config, (6)-DIO8/Sleep_Request, (5)-DIO6/RTS, (4)-DIO0/AD0, (3)-DIO1/AD1, (2)-DIO2/AD2, (1)-DIO3/AD3, (0)-DIO4

setting.name: Drive Strength
setting.description: The bit field used to configure the drive strength for digital output. 1=6mA, 0=2mA. See PR command for bit map of DIO lines. The bits in this command only apply when corresponding DIO line is configured for digital output.

setting.name: PWM0 Duty Cycle
setting.description: The duty cycle of PWM0 when P0 is 2.

setting.name: PWM1 Duty Cycle
setting.description: The duty cycle of PWM1 when P1 is 2.

setting.name: Associate LED Blink Time
setting.description: The associate LED blink rate. This value determines the blink rate of the DIO5/Associate pin if D5=1. Setting LT to 0 will use the default blink time (250ms).

setting.name: RSSI PWM Timer
setting.description: The PWM timer expiration in 0.1 seconds. It sets the duration of PWM (pulse width modulation) signal output on the RSSI pin. The signal duty cycle is updated with each received packet and is shut off when the timer expires.

category.name: I/O Sampling
category.description: Configure I/O Sampling Parameters. Click on + to expand the list of parameters.

setting.name: Analog Voltage Reference
setting.description: The analog voltage reference that is used for A/D sampling.

setting.name: DIO Change Detect
setting.description: This is a bit field used for change detect monitoring. Each bit enables monitoring of DIO0-DIO12 for changes. If detected, data is transmitted with DIO data only.

setting.name: Sleep Sample Rate
setting.description: The number of sleep cycles that must elapse between periodic IO samples. This allows IO samples to be taken only during some wake cycles. During those cycles IO samples are taken at the rate specified by IR.

setting.name: Sample Rate
setting.description: The time between samples. When set this parameter causes the module to sample all enabled DIO and ADC at a specified interval.

setting.name: Temperature
setting.description: The current module temperature in degrees celsius in 8-bit two's-complement format. For example 0x1A = 26C, and 0xF6 = -10C

setting.name: Supply Voltage
setting.description: The supply voltage of the module in mV.

category.name: Output Control
category.description: Control output level of pins configured for output

setting.name: IO command mask
setting.description: The bit mask used to enable (1) or disable (0) bits in IO command

setting.name: D0 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin D0 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: D1 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin D1 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: D2 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin D2 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: D3 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin D3 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: D4 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin D4 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: D5 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin D5 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: D6 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin D6 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: D7 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin D7 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: D8 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin D8 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: D9 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin D9 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: P0 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin P0 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: P1 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin P1 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: P2 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin P2 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: P3 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin P3 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: P4 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin P4 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: Association Timeout After Wakeup
setting.description: The association timeout after wakeup from deep sleep when sleep was entered without first being associated.

setting.name: Sleep Mode
setting.description: Normal mode is always awake. Pin sleep is based on SleepRq pin. Cyclic mode sleeps for SP time and wakes for ST time if activity occurs immediately. Cyclic sleep pin wake is the same as cyclic sleep but a negated SleepRq keeps it awake.

setting.name: Sleep Options
setting.description: Sleep Options Bit field. Bit 6 - Stay associated with AP during sleep. Bit 9 - Disassociate from AP for Deep Sleep. All other bits ignored.

setting.name: Sleep Time
setting.description: The sleep time of the module. In deep, cyclic sleep mode, node will sleep with CTS disabled for the sleep time interval, then wake for the wake time interval.

setting.name: Wake Time
setting.description: The wake time for clyclic sleep modes. New data will not refresh the timer. However, if there is data to transmit or receive after ST expires, those actions will occur before the module goes to sleep.

setting.name: Wake Host Delay
setting.description: The time the module will delay before sending serial data out the UART or taking IO samples after waking from sleep. This can be used to give a sleeping host processor sufficient time to power up after the module asserts the ON_SLEEP line.

setting.name: Command Sequence Character
setting.description: The character value used to enter command mode. The default value (0x2B) is the ASCII code for the plus ('+') character. It must be entered three times within the guard time to enter command mode.

setting.name: Command Mode Timeout
setting.description: The command mode timeout parameter. If no valid commands have been received within this time period, module returns to Idle Mode from AT Command Mode.

setting.name: Guard Times
setting.description: The required period of silence before, after, and between the Command Mode Characters of the Command Mode Sequence (GT + CC + GT). The period of silence is used to prevent inadvertent entrance into AT Command Mode.

category.name: Firmware actions
category.description: This firmware allows you to execute the following actions.
